title: Singular Paintings
paragraphs: Oil painting on board; 28 x 60 cm within frame. Unsigned and undated. Possibly by F.J. Lloyd as a similar work by him was auctioned in London on 22 October 1980 (W.L. Crowther Library)
WILLIAMS A native bird with mountain berries and native flora, backed by Mount Wellington. National Gallery of Australia. Painted 1873-75 National Gallery of Australia. Image ref: 283036

Roland Wakelin. Mount Wellington 1935 By the early 1930s the tide of critical opinion was beginning to ebb in favour of modern art and Wakelin was beginning to be rightfully acknowledged as a pioneer in Australian art. He was subsequently included in the major 1938 survey 150 years of Australian art and was also the subject of a 1942 retrospective at the Art Gallery of NSW. From the mid 1930s until the 1960s, Wakelin’s works – predominately regional landscapes and urban scenes – entered a romantic phase characterised by moody light and shadow…’ NSW Art Gallery
Robert Campbell lived in Tasmania between 1941 - 1949
oil on canvas 90 cm x 210 cm 2019
Sama Hut woodblock print by Alex White 2024. First exhibited Rosny Schoolhouse, August 2024
